result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 8:03 AM Defendant Marcus R Benson in court.  Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video for Marcus R Benson.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM95, 21CF240, 21CM158, 22CF25, and 22CF40.  21CM158 was DRI during pleas, due to parties agreement.  No new PSI.  No agreement for sentencing.  State has complied with victim rights.  Multiple files contain VIS, court has reviewed, restitution summaries which were dealt with $9311.49 21CF240, $3540.81 for 21CM95, and $565.48 in 22CF25.  Def did not participate in PSI process.  Court has reviewed states sentencing recommendation.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  See attached for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2022 at 08:00 am.

8:30 AM Defendant Marcus R Benson in court.  Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video for Marcus R Benson.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF40, 22CF25, 21CF240, and 21CM95.  Atty filed in each request to adjourn sentencing.  State comments on request, has filed with sentencing recommendation.  Court grants request to adjourn.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 08:00 am.
St's Sentencing Recommendation
for Adjournment

9:36 AM Defendant Marcus R Benson in court.  Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video for Marcus R Benson.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF25, 21CF240 and 21CM95.   Restitution in 22CF25 previously stipulated.  21CF240 and 21CM95 here for restitution.  State parties have agreement with regards of restitution.  $9311.49 in 21CM95 and $3540.81 ordered for restitution. State has complied with victim rights.  $565.48 in case 22CF25.  Def needs to appear for sentencing hearing.
Restitution hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:31 AM Defendant Marcus R Benson in court.  Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video for Marcus R Benson.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM95, 21CF240, 21CM158, 22CF25, and 22CF40.  No offer to settle filed in case, suggests an agreement, with entering pleas and free to argue.  Attorney agrees.  State did not think that it was free to argue, but to follow the offer to settle.  Attorneys placed in break out room.  Back on record at 9:37, status prepared to proceed.  21CM95 dispute regarding restitution, no agreement regarding amount.  21CF240 dispute regarding restitution, no agreement regarding amount.  21CF25 restitution is NOT disputed.  In 21CF25 CT 5 not on offer but is supposed to be with a DRI, has that on PLQ in file.  Taking pleas and all parties free to argue sentencing.  State has complied with victim rights.  Will take pleas today, schedule sentencing hearing, and schedule restitution hearing.  Off the record attorney and def in break out room.  Back on the record 9:51.  Attorney and def prepared to go forward with pleas today.  Parties in agreement.  State has complied with victim rights.  Def understands counts and range of penalties.  Def PLEADS NO CONTEST to the ten counts.  Each file contains PLQ, reviewed with attorney, understands information.  understands rights giving up, understands elements.  Attorney and def admit that the act of domestic abuse was an act of battery.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently pleading NO CONTEST and accepts pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the complaints, parties agree, court finds a factual basis exists, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter in each case.  Court is ordering a PSI.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Restitution hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
